intro: Pterostemma calceolaris, commonly known as the starry pterostemma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
